description: Six reports on practical topics (chordates, sharks, bony fish, frogs & reptiles, birds, mammals) involving lab work, drawings, and a field trip. Each report is submitted during specified weeks and provides feedback for course content understanding.
Multiple-choice questionnaire in Week 4 assessing content from initial practical sessions. Conducted online in the BEES computer laboratory.
Summative MCQ test in Week 10 covering all practical content (weeks 1-9), focusing on specimens and concepts from labs. Includes questions on post-Week 4 material.
2-hour 10-minute MCQ exam during the official university examination period. Tests problem-solving skills and knowledge from all lecture topics across the term.
